de.erichseifert.gral.plots

Class XYPlot

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.erichseifert.gral.graphics.AbstractDrawable
      • de.erichseifert.gral.graphics.DrawableContainer
        • de.erichseifert.gral.plots.StylableContainer
          • de.erichseifert.gral.plots.AbstractPlot
            • de.erichseifert.gral.plots.XYPlot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataListener, Container, Drawable, Navigable, AxisListener, Plot, SettingsListener, SettingsStorage, Serializable, Iterable<Drawable>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BarPlot, BoxPlot, RasterPlot

    public class XYPlot
extends AbstractPlot
implements Navigable, AxisListener

    Class that displays data in an two dimensional coordinate system (x-y plot). It also serves as a base class for many other plot types.

    To create a new XYPlot simply create a new instance using one or more data sources. Example:

     DataTable data = new DataTable(Integer.class, Integer.class);
 data.add( 1, 2);
 data.add(-5, 0);

 XYPlot plot = new XYPlot(data);
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static class  XYPlot.XYPlotNavigator
      Navigator implementation for two-dimensional plots.
